content.html:
P, S, A, and M Modes


P, S, A, and M modes give you varying degrees of control
over shutter speed and aperture.

Mode P: Program AE


Let the camera choose shutter speed and aperture for optimal
exposure. Other values that produce the same exposure can be
selected with program shift.

The camera functions in mode P (program AE) when the shutter
speed dial is rotated to A or P. Aperture is set as follows.

Aperture
Shutter speed dial7 8 50 09 25 4000 1000 500 2 50 8 2000 P ( 画自 57)The camera functions in mode P regardless of the option selected for aperture (□□ 42).
て 7 oo 50 40 2000 1000 50 18 x0 12 A ( 美食 57)rotating the ring to A (auto). Lenses with aperture rings: Mode P can be selected by ● Lenses without aperture rings: Mode P can be selected by pressing the center of the front command dial to cycle to APERTURE and then rotating the dial to choose A (auto).

5

Taking
Photographs

● The method for adjusting aperture when using a lens without an
aperture ring can be chosen using BUTTON/DIAL SETTING >
APERTURE SETTING (目 230).
● Front command dial settings can be adjusted using 8 BUTTON/
DIAL SETTING > COMMAND DIAL SETTING ( == 67, 226).

56
content.markdown:
# P, S, A, and M Modes

P, S, A, and M modes give you varying degrees of control
over shutter speed and aperture.

# Mode P: Program AE

Let the camera choose shutter speed and aperture for optimal
exposure. Other values that produce the same exposure can be
selected with program shift.

The camera functions in mode P (program AE) when the shutter
speed dial is rotated to A or P. Aperture is set as follows.

|  |  | Aperture |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Shutter speed dial | 7 8 50 09 25 4000 1000 500 2 50 8 2000 P ( 画自 57) | The camera functions in mode P regardless of the option selected for aperture (□□ 42). |
| Shutter speed dial | て 7 oo 50 40 2000 1000 50 18 x0 12 A ( 美食 57) | rotating the ring to A (auto). Lenses with aperture rings: Mode P can be selected by ● Lenses without aperture rings: Mode P can be selected by pressing the center of the front command dial to cycle to APERTURE and then rotating the dial to choose A (auto). |


5

Taking
Photographs

- ● The method for adjusting aperture when using a lens without an
- aperture ring can be chosen using BUTTON/DIAL SETTING >
- APERTURE SETTING (目 230).
- ● Front command dial settings can be adjusted using 8 BUTTON/
- DIAL SETTING > COMMAND DIAL SETTING ( == 67, 226).
